comments:
I have created a UI contributing plugin with a ViewPart, a help plugin, and a 
feature plugin tying them together.  I then created an Update Site plugin, 
attached the feature plugin, defined a category, and clicked "Build All".  This 
is what I get.  If I delete the Update Site project and regenerate it, it seems 
to work until I increment the versions of my plugins and feature, then I get 
this error again:


An internal error occurred during: "PDE Export".
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match 
outer scope rule: MultiRule
[P/com.iwaysoftware.ibsexp.update,org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.Fe
atureExportJob$SchedulingRule@d72782]
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:58)
org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.illegalPush(ThreadJob.java:106)
org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.push(ThreadJob.java:200)
org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.begin(ImplicitJobs.java:80)
org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.beginRule(JobManager.java:170)
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkIn(WorkManager.java:95)
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.prepareOperation
(Workspace.java:1628)
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.refreshLocal(Resource.java:1224)
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build.BuildSiteJob.refresh(BuildSiteJob.java:53)
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build.BuildSiteJob.run(BuildSiteJob.java:42)
org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

I have more information regarding this bug:

1) 3.1M5's "Build All" works with no errors.  But this may be because my 3.1M5 
instance does not use VSS (see #2).
2) This is related to the Visual Source Safe plugin.  (org.vssplugin_1.6.0)
  The error ONLY occurs for projects that are associated with a directory in 
VSS.  If I remove the VSS connection, the PDE Build works fine.  If I 
reassociate the project with VSS, it fails.  I've tried marking files 
read/write, checking out all the files, etc. with no effect.

So for now my workaround is to deassociate VSS with my update site project 
every time I want to release a build.

We have no control over what behavior add-on non-SDK plugins exhibit.

please reopen if you can reproduce on Eclipse-proper.  Thanks.

Ok, I have the same problem, with another repository provider - I'm using 
Perforce.
The error could be reproduced, if one first create:
1) plugin project
2) feature project for this plugin
3) update site for feature project
If none of projects are connected to team provider, "build all" works perfectly.
Then I have connected all three projects to Perforce, incremented plugin and 
feature versions and got during "build all" the same error:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match 
outer scope rule: MultiRule[P/ALUpdateSite,org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build.
FeatureExportJob$SchedulingRule@9bfaff]
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.illegalPush(ThreadJob.java:
117)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ThreadJob.push(ThreadJob.java:211)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.ImplicitJobs.begin(ImplicitJobs.java:81)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.beginRule(JobManager.java:
190)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkIn(WorkManager.
java:96)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.
prepareOperation(Workspace.java:1674)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.refreshLocal(Resource.
java:1240)
	at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build.BuildSiteJob.run(BuildSiteJob.java:
81)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)


eclipse.buildId=I20050617-1618
java.version=1.5.0_05

The workaround for me was the same as for Ken in comment 1 - I have disconnected 
the update site from team provider and then "build all" was working again.

I think the problem is related not only to Visual Source Safe plugin (I'm using 
Perforce), so please consider that this is a bug in PDE.

traces.message: Attempted to beginRule: R/, does not match  outer scope rule: MultiRule[P/ALUpdateSite,org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.build. FeatureExportJob$SchedulingRule@9bfaff]
